intro: Lasianthus hirsutisepalus, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
